text: Slave Convoys Available
Convoy routes to sell off the slaves are now available for use in the [[col:yellow]]Military Convoys[[/col]] panel. Such an enterprise is very profitable, but opportunity does not come without risk.

The Slave Convoy led by #(caravan_master) has sold its wares in #(end_area) for #(pooled_resource.icon)#(amount). It will now begin the return journey to your capital.\\n\\nThe demand for trade goods in #(end_area) is now reduced but will increase steadily over time.
Draw weapons
Fresh new slaves!
We don't need the hassle
One lousy Caravan isn't worth the bother. The Cathayans can keep their lives for today, and their paltry cargo.
Slaughter sounds nice!
We were short for short slaves
Let them go
What a waste of time
Seize Their Treasures
Fight them! Break their ancient bones and seize their wealth.
Move On
We must not be distracted from our goal. Leave them to their Unlife.
Numbers are superior
Rise my minions!
Empower the existing army
Empower the existing army with the corpses
Kill these creatures
Hungry are they? Well in that case they can fill their bellies with our blades!
Keep these beasts at bay
What's a few sacrifices for the many? It was probably time to cull the weak anyway – these Daemons are doing you a favour!
Fight Them
We will crush this host and make our consignment even more lucrative than it already is!
Ignore Them
Hostilities and losses can be easily avoided if we just keep moving.
Sharper Axe Blades
To end a fight as quickly and easily as possible, one needs the capacity to deal the lethal blow.
Sturdier Armour
One who can endure the most dangerous and prolonged attacks has the best chance of landing a lethal counterattack.
Take the Ogres' assistance
Who are we to leave these poor Ogre mercenaries without work? Times are hard, after all!
Tell them to get lost
You are a strong and independent. Who needs an Ogre anyway!
Take the risky path
A detour through a strange portal in a dark, underground passageway… When you put it like that, what could go wrong?
We have no time to waste
We have no time to go wandering through portals. We must continue on our journey!
Finders keepers
We found it and it's ours! If these Daemons love their Cargo so much, they shouldn't have just left it lying around!
Give the cargo back
We don't need their goods, anyway. Grateful Daemons, on the other hand…
We'll take those Daemons
Powerful Daemons for our army? Yes please!
The other Daemons, please
Obviously these are the superior Daemons... Think of the bloodshed!
Feed It
The urge to sacrifice one of the retinue into this strange formation is hard to ignore; it feels like there is great power to be had here.
Ignore It
Ignore it – it is best not to meddle in things we do not understand.
Take the Shortcut
We can handle a few off-road chicanes – any potential losses will probably cost us less in the long run than gaining a reputation for tardiness.
Slow and Steady
We should stick to the main route and avoid exposing the cargo to any unnecessary risks.
Kill the rats
Kill some rats and reduce the length of our journey? Sounds like a win-win!
Not worth it
We don't know how many rats are in this convoy. The last thing we need is to be overwhelmed by the vermin!
Destroy Them All
The smell of gunpowder is preferable to the smell of rotting flesh. Eliminate them!
Cover Our Escape
Their sacrifice allows us to continue without further losses.
Show them their place
Their attempts at an ambush are frankly so embarrassing it would be an insult to Hashut to let them live.
Let them get whoever is next
They might get lucky one day. Probably not any time soon, though.
Find your own path
We don't need any guidance! We have an excellent sense of direction, thank you very much!
Pay and follow the guide
We need to reach our destination quickly; this guide had better be worth the price!
Accept the Beast
With this beast in our Convoy’s ranks, assailants will not consider us an easy target.
Decline the Trade
It would be foolish to part with some of our cargo – we have no need for this beast and can adequately protect ourselves.
Combat Drills
We can brook no frailty in this Convoy. This is time well invested.
No Delays!
Training is always important, but we must not lose track of time.
Stick to the Road
We cannot risk this untested path.
Through Storm
Our troops can handle a few loss of lives.
Convoy Encounter! Cathay Caravan

A lonely Caravan has been spotted trundling through nearby land, bearing the banners of Cathay. No doubt the products of the so-called Celestial Empire would be worth snatching for ourselves, yet such spoils are not likely to lie unguarded.\\n\\nA choice between killing or caution. It seems the answer is clear...
Convoy Encounter! A Dwarf Too Far
A wandering Convoy of Dwarf has entered our site. Should we attack them for a fresh new set of slaves?
Convoy Encounter! Unceasing March

Signs of a troop column have been spotted ahead. Judging by the tracks, it looks as though this force has been moving without sleep or pause. Cresting the next hill, the gleam of bone and gold can be seen throughout the army. A host of Tomb Kings, richly adorned, is marching through this area. Their destination is unclear, but their opulence is not. We could descend upon them, and claim their riches for ourselves!
Convoy Encounter! Fresh Battlefield
It seems like there was a big battle nearby, we can use it to raise more troops or use its magical power to empower the troops.
Convoy Encounter! Hungry Daemons

Traversing realms is hungry work if these Daemons we've encountered are to be believed. You could choose to sate their gluttonous appetites in the hopes of avoiding a fight. Yet, on the other hand, death would solve their hunger too…
Convoy Encounter! Elfy Profits

Unfortunate wretches of many races travel the sea to gather wealth. Yet while out on assignment, even our Convoy knows not to pass up the opportunity to attain more of the "right tools" for the job, having encountered a High Elf host from whom much profit could be forcibly reaped – both in long-limbed Labourers and loot reaped from beardless corpses.
Convoy Encounter! Dark Magic Artifcat
A great artifact of dark magic has come to our grasp. However, we need to decide which equipment we should empower to give the Convoy the greatest chance of successfully repelling any threats.
Convoy Encounter! Ogre Mercenaries

The strength of an Ogre is unmatched anywhere! At least, that's what this group of rotund mercenaries assured us when offering to guard our trade Convoy on its route. Their claim is ridiculous but the extra muscle wouldn't go amiss. Ogres' services, however, certainly would not come free of charge.
Convoy Encounter! Portals

While traveling through a maze of chaotic passages, our Convoy encountered a mysterious-looking portal, simply begging for further exploration. Both rewards and dangers could lie beyond its swirling vortex; is such a risk worth taking?
Convoy Encounter! Portals Again

Beyond the portal lay a bounty of Cargo, ripe for repossession. If someone was willing to leave it in the open like that, then surely nobody will miss it... except, of course, for the angry Daemons that greeted us upon our return, who demanded the return of their stolen horde.\\n\\nWe could fight to keep it, though simply returning it may grant an even greater reward...
Convoy Encounter! Portals: The Final Chapter

Who needs Cargo when you can secure the services of a party of vicious Daemons? On your generous return of the loot, two groups step forward, offering to rip your enemies into tiny, bloodstained pieces. Delightful! The bickering and chest-pounding that ensues between the groups is less pleasing. It seems you're going to have to choose...
Convoy Encounter! A Whisper

Without warning, a sudden chill rushes through the bones. A torrent of whispers floods the heads of the warriors, all repeating the same thing.\\n\\n[[i]]"Make a sacrifice, and overwhelming power shall be yours…"[[/i]]
Convoy Encounter! A Quick Way
The Convoy Master scouts a quicker route which would make up for the lost time. However, looking at the weather, that shortcut would result in some damaged 'goods'.
Convoy Encounter! Rats
This ship is filled with rats! Unless we have dealt with them sooner or we will have to make a stop to refill our supplies. Maybe we need to track them all and kill them.
Convoy Encounter! Skulking Horde

Fog has descended around our Convoy. The smell is putrid and shuffling shapes can be glimpsed in the haze. This land around us teems with their shambling forms; we have stumbled, unwittingly, into the domain of the Undead. These creatures can be confronted head-on and the wretches put down for good or, alternatively, we can order some of our number to distract them while we make our escape, though they will ultimately have no hope against the necrotic masses.
Convoy Encounter! The Ambush

Stealth is possibly not the strong suit of our would-be ambushers, who visibly await our Convoy from some rather questionable 'hiding' places. We could avoid them easily, of course, but it almost seems a disservice not to show them what a true ambush looks like...
Convoy Encounter! The Guide

A guide has tracked down our Convoy, offering to lead the way to our destination in exchange for a reasonable donation to his pockets. His price is frankly extortionate, but as they say in business, time is of the essence.
Convoy Encounter! The Beastmaster

A cacophony of roars and feral shrieks rings out ahead of your Convoy – a Dark Elf Beastmaster approaches! By the look of his shackled beasts, he is recently returned from an expedition into Norsca and poses little threat, his retinue of hunters visibly weary and battered from their run-ins with the Northmen and critters of the tundra. With a tired Druchii sneer, he offers the Convoy one of his creatures in exchange for some slaves. Though we care little for the Dark Elf’s plight, such a beast could be useful against future threats.
Convoy Encounter! Duelling Shrine

The day may have just begun, but one of the scouts has already spotted a wide, flat, stone platform in an isolated area. A series of eight steps leads to an eight-sided arena, with grooves carved in the floor to drain the blood spilled. Unmistakably, this is a Khornate combat shrine: the perfect location to tutor troops and beat the weakness out of them.
Convoy Encounter! The Path of Storm
A strong current is in front of our eyes. We can traverse this rough current and reach our destination sooner, but it may take the lives of some of our weaker personnel.
The Path of Storm
Harsh sea take their blood tithe from the weak and feeble first.
Clad in Durability
The arcane processes grant these shields and armour greater effectiveness, for a time.
Wielding Destruction
The arcane processes grant these weapons much greater lethality, for a time.
Criminal Network Overseer
Criminal Network Overseer
Establish Criminal Network
[[col:yellow]]Establishes a criminal network in the target settlement. This agent will be no longer available after this action[[/col]]
Criminal Network Overseer Recruited

Following a successful slave import, Mundvard gains the services of a cunning Criminal Network Overseer, tasked with establishing a criminal network in a treacherous region of the Old World. With her expertise in deception and manipulation, she is determined to prove her worth to Mundvard and rise through the ranks of his organization.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]You'll gain Criminal Network Overseer if you don't have the "Criminal Network Established" modifier which is given when you establish a Criminal Network[[/col]]
Criminal Network Overseer
Criminal Network Overseer

Criminal Network Overseer is a cunning and resourceful criminal who has built a vast network of contacts and informants across the Old World. On Mundvard's orders, she will make a criminal network and oversees it from that place.
Criminal Network Overseer has been recruited
New Horizon
By acquiring Marienburg, we have gained access to the fabulous Gilded Route. An Ocean of Money awaits us.
At the tavern, you meet a giant guy who is claiming to be the right hand of Jaan. You give him a suspicious look, and he suddenly kicked your butt and joins your crew.
Gilded Route Completed – Unique Item
